conclusion: To determine whether the difference in speed between the two objects, A and B, is continuously increasing during the time interval from 0 to t1, we need to analyze the velocity-time graphs (v-t graphs) for both objects.
Graph A shows a curve that starts at a lower velocity and increases to a peak velocity before decreasing back to a lower velocity.

premise: Graph A shows a curve that starts at a lower velocity and increases to a peak velocity before decreasing back to a lower velocity.
conclusion: The peak velocity is higher than the initial velocity, indicating that the speed of object A is continuously increasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
Graph B shows a curve that starts at a lower velocity and decreases to a lower velocity before increasing back to a higher velocity.

premise: Graph B shows a curve that starts at a lower velocity and decreases to a lower velocity before increasing back to a higher velocity.
conclusion: The peak velocity is lower than the initial velocity, indicating that the speed of object B is continuously decreasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.

premise: The speed of object A is continuously increasing and the speed of object B is continuously decreasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
conclusion: The difference in speed between the two objects, A and B, is continuously increasing during the time interval from 0 to t1.
